channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ravenscroft (near Finchley Road), 14th September
item.description:
Consistently seeing either old fridge, garbage on the side of the streets or deserted items like this suitcase.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Templars Avenue, Temple Fortune, London

item.title: Extensive spray tagging on the solid black shutters of either Headmaster barbers 25, High St, Penge or no. 27, Pride of Venice Cafe., 14th September
item.description:
Extensive spray tagging on the solid black shutters of either Headmaster barbers 25, High St, Penge or no. 27, Pride of Venice Cafe. Seen from moving vehicle and reported from memory so I cannot remember which. Seen today, Sunday, so most shop shutters are pulled down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please remove this wall covered in graffiti tags, 14th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London

item.title: Streetlight is out and balcony lights are out near SE2 9SY, 14th September
item.description:
The streetlight is not working since it has been out for a month now. Also, the surroundings lights in the car park area of SE2 9SY have been out since a month ago which makes it feel dangerous to walk through late at night since the area isn’t lit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lensbury Way, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slab that is ‘rocking’, 14th September
item.description:
‘Rocking’ paving slab, very very very wobbly and sticks super high into the air. It’s so dangerous, went flying over it the other day and have been in agony with my back ever since. Really dangerous to children/eldely in particular. Seems to be getting worse over the days too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, The Grove, North Cray, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
